# Background

---

class: center, top

# Potential advantages
.left[
## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> More precise control over FiO<sub>2</sub>
## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Reduce airway obstruction
## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Active gas exchange during apnea
## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> May decrease carbon dioxide retention
]
---

class: center, top

# Potential disadvantages
.left[
## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Reduced ability to monitor ventilation from capnography waveforms due to exhaled carbon dioxide being "washed out" by the high flows of gas
## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Additional costs
]

---


class: center, middle

## Currently minimal evidence...3 trials published to date

--

##  But high interest...at least 7 more trials registered

class: left, middle

### <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Bronchoscopy (no difference in SpO<sub>2</sub> <90%)
### <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Endoscopy (no difference in SpO<sub>2</sub> <90%)
### <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Dental sedation (HFNO produced higher nadir SpO<sub>2</sub> levels )

# Getting Started

---

class: center, middle

## <i class="fas fa-play"></i> Commence O<sub>2</sub> at same time as usual

## <i class="fas fa-thermometer"></i> Set temperature to 'High' (ranges 30-32º Celsius)

## <i class="fas fa-wind"></i> Set flow rate to 30 litres per minute

## <i class="fas fa-tachometer-alt"></i> Set FiO<sub>2</sub> to 50%


---

class: inverse, center, middle

# Titrating

---

class: middle

## Once sedated:

## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Increase flow rate to ~ 50 litres per minute
## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Titrate up and down according to tolerance


---

class: center, top

### Interaction of gas flow from cardiogenic oscillations and high‐flow nasal oxygenation provides a mechanism for transporting carbon dioxide from the carina to the pharynx 

<center><img src="https://aconway.dev/images/CO2clearance.png" width="600px" height="auto"></center>
  
<br>
Anaesthesia, Volume: 74, Issue: 4, Pages: 441-449., DOI: (10.1111/anae.14541)

---

class: inverse, center, middle
# Considerations

---

class: middle

#  <i class="fas fa-knife-kitchen"></i> Diathermy


### <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Decrease FiO<sub>2</sub> to 25% for ~2 mins prior to and during use

---

class: middle

#  <i class="fas fa-bell"></i> Oxygen desaturation

## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Maintian saturations above 93% as per policy
## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> FiO<sub>2</sub> and flow rate can be increased

**FiO<sub>2</sub> will be accurate when flow rate is 30 litres per minute or higher*

---

class: middle

#  <i class="fas fa-frown-open"></i> Nasal discomfort 

## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Decrease flow rate*

## <i class="fas fa-angle-double-right"></i> Adjust temperature setting

**Attempt to maintain flow rate at 30 litres per minute or higher*

---
